title: Anxiety App 1
description:
Phobias Anxiety Disorders


Fear is sometimes considered to be an integral element of the human psyche, keeping people from jumping into situations that can be considered dangerous or disadvantageous.



However, there are times when fear can effectively cripple a person’s ability to do what needs to be done. This is particularly true if the fear comes in the form of anxiety disorders and phobias, which can sometimes be termed as being “unreasonable,” as compared to the more normal, “reasonable” fears.



Anxiety disorders and phobias, while distinct from one another, do have several common features. Both of them are considered to be an unhealthy fear.



Both are considered to be psychological disorders, though it is generally accepted that phobias emerge from anxiety disorders. For sure, there are a number of factors that cause anxiety disorders and phobias.



Anxiety disorders and phobias can be triggered by a number of stressful situations. But clearly, most studies indicate that anxiety disorders might take longer to form or develop as compared to phobias.



Some theorize that phobias are formed as part of the exaggerated aspect of the natural human survival instinct. Phobias are reactions to “natural threats” to a person’s well-being, for example, the fear of spiders or the fear of heights.



The difference lies in the severity of the fear reaction. A phobia can totally paralyze or debilitate a person while having a simple fear will just elicit a response that does not necessarily interrupt a person’s normal functions. 



In contrast, stress and anxiety takes a number of formative years to develop, or more appropriately, worsen before it affects a person. 



The stress and anxiety can actually lead to other phobias such as claustrophobia, the fear of closed spaces, and hexakosioihexekontahexaphobia —- which is the irrational fear of the number 666. 



According to some psychologists, stress and anxiety combined with external triggers and internal factors that impact on an individual’s psyche can cause phobias.



There are some who believe that anxiety disorders are not constant and can generally be treated with medication, whereas phobias are generally believed to require extensive therapy.



In reality, no credible, verifiable studies have produced results to back up this claim . Very little information is available and the research on the subject matter do not necessarily refute some of the existing theories. 



Interestingly, a number of modern “phobias” are highly social in nature, perhaps reflecting the growing sense of status anxiety and social anxiety people feel.



These particular phobias are generally considered to be non-clinical and are mere signs of mild social disorders that cannot be categorized as phobias.



Most experts view these new “phobias” as little more than signs of people developing social anxiety and status anxiety as a result of ignorance or misinformation.



There are also some that carry discriminatory undertones, such as a “phobia” that centers around the fear of Christianity and the various Christian denominations.



Social class and nationality also seem to be linked to the new generation of these so-called phobias, eliciting worries of national-level status anxiety in the face of expanding globalization.



Social anxiety is also hinted upon, with people starting to become more and more anxious about the increasing upward mobility available within various social and economic structures.



There are some that have theorized that people are starting to develop an instinctive fear of what is sometimes seen to be rapid social restructuring, linking to a more personal form of status anxiety than the large-scale example cited above.

title: Health Anxiety Wellness Hypnosis Meditations
description:
Are you constantly worried about your health and getting sick? Is your health anxiety stopping you from living your life to the full? Do you find that fear of illness and disease influences decisions you make about how you live your life?  Would you like to feel more in control of your life? Then this is the app for you!

Research has repeatedly shown us how using hypnosis you can improve your immune system and help you to feel more in control. It has been shown to lower pain levels and improve overall happiness and mindfulness.

Constantly feeling like you’re out of control of your thoughts about your health and wellness can be exhausting and can also stop you from taking some jobs or developing new friendships and relationships. Each time you worry about your health it re-enforces any limiting belief that you have about being in control of your own health and wellness.
This app will help you to feel and be more in control and less fearful about your health in general.

Listening to these powerful hypnosis sessions will help you to reduce your anxiety and will help you to feel more in control. As a result, you will become calmer and start to feel more confident.  You can listen at any time that you have a few minutes to spare or when you go to bed at night and just drift off to sleep as you listen.

App Features:
•	Overcome Your Fear of Wearing a Face Mask Meditation
•	Stop Touching Your Face Hypnosis
•	Manage Your Negative Thoughts Hypnosis
•	Movement Motivation
•	Pain Management Hypnotic Meditation
•	Reduce Stress & Boost Your Immune System Hypnosis
•	Be Happier Hypnosis
•	Reduce Your Anxiety Hypnosis
•	Positive Mindset Hypnosis

Everyone who purchases the ‘Health Anxiety’ app can join our free Facebook Support Group. Come and join in with like-minded, positive people who know just how you feel and will support you and celebrate your successes with you. And of course, you will be able to offer others your support too. It’s a closed group so only other group members can see and comment on your posts.

This application is intended to inform you and enhance your general knowledge in respect of health anxiety and should never be used as a substitute for medical care or advice. You must always seek medical advice for medical conditions and health issues such as depression and low mood. Do not listen to these hypnosis recordings whilst actually exercising, driving or operating machinery.

If you make the decision to apply any of the information in this application you are taking full responsibility for your actions and we are not responsible for any direct or indirect, punitive, special, incidental or any consequential damages that arise as a direct or indirect result of applying any part of this material which is provided in this application for educational purposes only and is without warranties.

comments: Being very much aware of good hygiene particularly during this pandemic, I wanted to find a way to minimise my risk of contracting any type of virus's, coughs and cold. I recognised that one of the risks I could improve was limiting the amount of times I touched my face. I found this app extremely useful in helping me achieve this, with the result of not touching my face unnecessarily. I'm extremely pleased with how effective the hypnosis was. I highly recommend this app, great value for money.

title: Reduced Anxiety & BP
description:
Taking care of our anxiety levels is more important today then any other time.

You may already know that by having a higher level than normal of anxiety decreases our immune system and increases our susceptibility to health issues from the very common problems all the way up to serious infections.


Our bodies use two protection systems - the Immune system for our insides and the adrenal system also called Fight or flight for outside threats.

The adrenal system is what the body uses to take vital energy and blood supply from the rest of the body to the heart, lungs, arms and legs to either fight or run from danger.

The adrenal system is also what kicks in when we are Anxious.

We perceive a threat and our bodies cant tell the difference between being attacked by a Wild Animal and the anxiety of something like getting on a plane, facing a day at work or something similar.


The problem is that long periods of Anxiety can take energy and blood-flow away from the immune system when it needs it most.

Fighting anxiety is as important as physical health as they go hand in hand.


How does it work?


Hypnotherapy guides your conscious mind to stop momentarily, just like when you zone out whilst driving or reading but still obtain control.

Whilst in this state our subconscious mind is literally ready for new positive suggestions.

A ‘hypnotic induction’ is the name of this process.

Your Anxiety Audio uses the same language and information that you would expect to hear during an actual hypnotherapy session but for a fraction of the price and of course to be listened to as often as you like, where ever you like.


The audio is 16 minutes long.

It begins with a brief simple explanation of how hypnosis works and then continues into an induction (hypnosis process), then Anxiety reducing guidance is given whilst you use your imagination to its fullest.

There is then a wake up process at the end of the audio where you are directed out of the hypnotic state and then open your eyes feeling fresh and reenergised with reduced Anxiety.


Directions of use


1. Do not exercise before

2. Do not drink coffee for up to 3 hours before using.

3. Use the toilet before using.

4. Find a time when you not be disturbed.

5. Turn any devices that could distract you off.

6. Wear loose and comfortable clothing.

7. Sit upright in a comfortable chair with you 2 feet flat on the floor.

8. Hydrate yourself before use.

9. We recommend you listen every day for a minimum of 7 days.

title: Children's Bedtime Meditations for Sleep & Calm
description:
This superb high quality children's meditation app by Diviniti Publishing features a number of children's bedtime meditation stories by best selling children's audio authors Nic & Sam, Christiane Kerr, Glenn Harrold, Christiane Kerr, Lynda Hudson, Dr Elizabeth Scott, Heather Bestel and Jan Yoxall. 

The app includes 6 completely free children's bedtime meditations, plus many more kids mindfulness meditations available as in-app purchases. 

The app has meditations and mindfulness tracks for children of all ages and covers a range of themes to help your kids to sleep soundly at night. The topics include sleep, bedtime, mindfulness, general confidence, anxiety, stress, self esteem and more. The meditations can help kids with feeling of confidence and motivation at school, with peer pressure and fitting in with friends and to generally feel happier and more positive. The variety of styles and themes in this kids app make it the must have children's meditation app for all situations. We will be adding more high quality tracks covering specific themes often.

The recordings are always very professionally produced and they typically work by guiding children into a natural state of relaxation through a number of carefully scripted story meditations. Each meditation story has an underlay of dreamy and gentle music combined with a calming voice make them engaging and deeply relaxing. These recordings will help children to relax and enhance feelings of contentment and also help with general relaxation, or even (in the case of Christiane's tracks), as a teaching resource.

Children’s Bedtime Sleep Meditations Features:
• 6 kids meditations to download and listen to completely free.
• High quality professional recording techniques.
• Calm reassuring voices safely guiding your kids into a completely relaxed state of mind & body. 
• Soothing background sounds for children.
• In-app purchases featuring many children's bedtime sleep meditations for boys and girls of all ages.
• Children's Breathe Feature - prompting your kids to relax through their breath.

We have revamped the app and given it a complete makeover! New features include:

• 2 new FREE meditations
• 23 NEW meditations by Christiane Kerr, Lynda Hudson & Dr Elizabeth Scott
• New Design & Interface

comments: My daughter and I both love this app for when we are struggling to get to sleep or are wakeful in the night. My daughter is 9 now but we have been using these meditations since she was a toddler. It's not just for kids either - as a shift worker my sleep patterns are all over the place, but a gentle familiar story with its soothing music can get me off to sleep when I need to.

I love his app, before i got this, i couldnt get to sleep at all. But now i have it im aslepp within minuites. This app is perfect for people who struggle to sleep at night. Its amazing. 10/10. One thing i would add. Though. Is that you could rewind the video while its paused. Otherwise, its a great app!

Used this with my daughter when she has some anxiety at bedtime (she is 8) and it helped alot! Thank you. Simple imaginative ideas like putting worries in a balloon and letting them float away along with muscle relaxation worked for her. We appreciate the effort that has gone into this app and it has helped. Thanks 🙂

This app has several free bedtime relaxation/meditation recordings to choose from. Since it takes longer than a few minutes for my 7-year-old to sleep, we use the 15-minute one. He's asleep in 12 min - even me - if I listen! Earlier, I played bedtime story apps. My son would listen to a few of them (lasting at times 60+ minutes). Bedtime stories are great to listen to, but not to relax the mind. They keep a child up as s/he listens to the end and another begins.

Have I used it enough? Not Yet! But loving my first 2 sessions, with the kids. My kids love it. I highly recommend to any family that love to read to their kids. Life get so busy we often forget to unwind in that golden moment before bedtime. This App is great reminder to unwind xx

title: Shantam - Improve Sleep & Focus, Reduce Anxiety
description:
Listening to calming music is a proven method to manage your stress, reduce anxiety, and even sleep better at night. Shantam is a free anxiety relief app for Android that delivers a unique collection of peaceful and soothing music and helps you be mindful and relax. 

⭐ What are the available ambient relaxing sounds?

In this free stress management app to reduce anxiety and focus better, you can find a unique collection of high-quality soothing music, including:

• Forest and nature sounds
• Meditation sounds
• Bird singing sounds
• Raining and thunderstorm sounds
• Seaside, riverside and lakeside sounds
• White noise sounds

The wide range of available relaxing and meditating melodies makes sure you can always find soft music suiting your current mood. 

No matter you are looking for a relaxing app to help you with managing your stress and reduce anxiety, you are looking for a collection of meditation melodies to focus better, or you are looking for some soothing music to sleep better and more comfortably, we’ve got you covered.

Download Shantam for free on your Android device, choose your preferred relaxing sound in the collection of high-quality ambient sounds, and enjoy listening to the music while being relaxed and mindful. 

⭐ Set a timer: Imagine you are listening to peaceful music before getting to the bed. Wouldn’t it be nice if you had the option to set a timer and let the music stop automatically? Well, with Shantam, you can easily set a timer, and the relaxing music will end automatically. 

⭐ Turn on Shuffle or Repeat mode, should you wish to listen to relaxing music randomly, or stick to a specific melody.

⭐Who should install this free collection of relaxing music?

Well, if you are one of the following types of users, then this relaxing app can easily become your best companion to reduce stress, sleep more peacefully, and focus better:

✨ One. If you are having difficulties sleeping at night, and always struggle to sleep with peace of mind.

✨ Two. If you are dealing with constant worry and anxiety, and looking for a way to manage your stress and relieve your anxiety.

✨ Three. If you are studying or working on a project, and need to be fully focused and concentrated on the task you are doing.
In overall, Shantam is going to bring you peace of mind and help you relax and be mindful.

⭐ Shantam main features at a glance:

• Clean and neat design with a fresh and intuitive interface
• Unique collection of high-quality peaceful melodies
• Listen to meditation and relaxing sounds in different categories: bird sound, rain sounds, white noise, nature sounds, forest sounds and much more
• Set a timer to turn the music off automatically
• Shuffle mode and repeat mode
• Useful for relieving anxiety, manage stress, sleeping better, and concentrating
• Free to use

So, download Shantam, the free stress management app for free on your Android phone or tablet, and listen to your favorite meditation and relaxing sounds with high streaming quality.

Stay tuned and let us know about any bugs, questions, feature requests, or any other suggestions.

title: Natural Remedies For Anxiety - Take Control
description:
Some anxiety is a normal part of life. It’s a byproduct of living in an often-chaotic world. Anxiety isn’t all bad, though. It makes you aware of danger, motivates you to stay organized and prepared, and helps you calculate risks. Still, when anxiety becomes a daily struggle, it’s time to act before it snowballs. Unchecked anxiety may greatly impact your quality of life. 

Whether you experience panic attacks from time to time or suffer from chronic anxiety, it can be scary, especially when it impacts your professional performance (or that of your employees).

Many of those who suffer from anxiety don't seek treatment for it, in part because they don't want to take pharmaceutical medication. However, there are a number of natural remedies for anxiety that can make a significant difference.

Download the App Now to unlock all the information and take control. App Updated Regularly.

description:

So here are 3 stress busting tips

Resolve right now to release every thought from yesterday and be only mindful of the now…. this thought only...this b...

title: The Zone: Daily Self Care & Gratitude Journal App
description:
The Zone is a home for your thoughts, emotions & mental health. 😇

HEAR IT FROM OUR COMMUNITY

"So far, i love it!! it's the best journaling app that doesn't make you buy subscription!"

"Thank you for this app because of your app I'm feeling relaxed and happy. Really the best UI for journaling I've ever seen. Im grateful for finding this app 😊"

" For an app that released less than a month ago, it is absolutely incredible. I've tried probably around a hundred journal apps over the past two years, and this is by far the best one."

START FEELING BETTER NOW

If you want to build a healthier and more mindful lifestyle, are facing a difficult or stressful time, want to address any negativity or anxiety in your life, or just want to feel focused and in control: The Zone is here to help.

And there's no need to fear the blank page! With interactive guides tailored to improve confidence, gratitude, and focus or address anxiety, loneliness, and goal-setting, The Zone makes the benefits of a journaling practice easy and accessible.

Plus everything you enter in The Zone is protected for your eyes only, always. All entries are automatically encrypted and each user can set their own encryption key, for maximum security. We do not sell user data or run ads.

RECOMMENDED BY EXPERTS

Journaling is like yoga for the mind. It's a healthy, mindful practice, recommended by therapists, psychologists, and leading professionals (like Oprah Winfrey and Tim Ferriss) to improve mood, health, and productivity.

Through its guided structure, The Zone makes practices used by therapists and CBT experts accessible and interactive. Plus, studies have found that journaling can improve physical and mental health and make you 42% more likely to achieve your goals.

FEATURES 

We believe that journaling is the best medium for the creative expression of our feelings. Our team talked to thousands of people about their journaling practice and found out that everyone has their own unique way of doing it!

Discover new ways to journal with The Zone!

- Free Writing - Write About Anything!
- Writing Prompts - Navigate Through Life with our guided questions!
- Goal Setting - Set Smart Goals.
- Avo-CAN-do - Manage and externalize your feelings with our cute & illustrative card therapy.
- Sleep Stories - Keep track of your subconscious mind.
- Visualization - Make better & more well informed decisions.
- More formats coming soon! Do let us know if you have something in mind :)

Some awesome features made possible by our machine learning based platform:

- Keep track of your overall mood over time
- Be more well-informed emotions that you may have experienced throughout the day
- Keep track of relevant keywords that matter to you over a period of time
- Keep track of the people that you interact with in your daily life.

The Zone is encrypted using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Further secure it using the TouchID or PIN features. 🔒

HELP US IMPROVE THE APP

The Zone is built by a community of journal and self-reflection enthusiasts.

Please sound out if you have any feedback or recommendations and we will be more than happy to talk to you!

- Send us an email - hello@getthezone.app
- Follow us on Instagram - @thezoneapp
- Join our Telegram Community - https://t.me/joinchat/AAAAAEt2s4wn2qMSA4gLnQ
- Website: https://getthezone.app
- Privacy: https://www.notion.so/Privacy-Policy-256579b73d8344beb1a6a87584a2a331

We look forward to helping you feel your best.

Download now, and get into the zone!

Note:
We foresee the app to be FREE for as long as possible - and we hope that it can be free forever! We do this in our spare time because of that as we need to earn a living wage in this capitalistic society. If you love the app and want to encourage us to keep adding updates to it, please feel free to drop us an email of encouragement, or leave a glowing review as that would really motivate us :)

Most importantly, leave a review so that more people can use it!

comments: I absolutely would recommend this to anyone and everyone. If you are like me and struggle to deal with anxiety, depression, self identity, stress, self esteem, etc. you should download this app. I thought it was silly at first, but after a while I noticed that it provided me a place to jot down my thoughts in a way that was easy to do. I suddenly noticed a great decrease in depression. This was because I was able to get all the negative thoughts out and start getting the positive in. Thank you!

So i love this app but i have to big complaints. One it shows that the dream diary and vision board options are available and they are not. The other is i lost my daily writing strike for nothing. In my writings you can clearly see the dates yet it takes it away from me? Idk. I love it other then that its just aggravating

Just loved the simplicity of the app. Best journalling app I have ever seen. For me, Its the world's best place to express my thoughts and emotions. Its analytic feature is amazing. Thank you : The Zone.. for giving such amazing service.

Great app, a lot of thought has been put into it. I would highly recommend this app to anyone who wants to get better at being able to control your Attitude/Mood/Emotions. ●Edit: I have not been able to journal anything down for a handful of days, everytime I'm in the loading phase, it automatically force closes the app.

This app just blew me away. I rarely rate/review apps, but this was way too well deserved to ignore. The UI, the writing prompts, the emotion cards, the creative passion put forth in the making of this app is very much so obvious after 5 minutes of working with it -I completely forgot I was using a self-care type of app. THEN, you went ahead and slapped the "analytics" portion on me like a cherry on a sundae! Idk you, but I'm so grateful for you. Thank you DEVs! -Madelyn

title: Beat-anxiety
description:
Anxiety affects 18.1% of the population throughout a lifetime which mean that you or someone you know has an almost 1 in 5 chance of developing an anxiety disorder. The good news is that there are effective treatments available to help you feel more in control and confident. Unfortunately for some, attending therapy is a big obstacle to overcome. Whether this be caused by time restriction, financial burden, fear about discussing your concerns or the unknown of therapy, these are real concerns.

This is why BEAT mental illness developed a comprehensive guide that provides you with the knowledge to understand where your anxiety stemmed from and the steps you need to take to overcome this. You will also find anxiety reduction strategies and tools to help improve your sleep.

Please note: This information is not designed to replace psychological intervention. If you or someone you know is at risk call your local authorities immediately. For more advice please visit your general practitioner for a referral to local support services in your area.

This  research tested app offers the following therapeutic benefits:

It has the potential to lower down anxiety, create focus, and increase mindfulness. 

Similar to meditation, this anti stress coloring app allows you to switch off your brain from other thoughts and focus on the moment, thereby helping to remove free-floating anxiety.  

Since coloring involves the use of both creativity and logic, the analytical side as well as the creative side of your brain are activated when coloring. 

Stress relief games and coloring games like this app, spark your creativity. Coloring makes adults more creative in their job, analytical thinking activities, and various realms of work and play. 

This colour therapy game trains the mind to concentrate better, relax and reset. Research shows that coloring can help adults attain academic and career success, and encourage them to deliver innovative work performance. 

Colouring is also a great way to exercise your fine motor skills. 

Filling colors in the images of the app removes your focus from negative habits and issues, and lets you focus in a productive and safe way.

The “prescription” of coloring for adults originated from the great psychologist Carl Jung, who considered coloring to be highly effective and helpful for human mind. Ben Michaelis, a clinical psychologist, says that coloring is a peaceful activity, which creates relaxing effects on the amygdala – the brain's fear center. Filling colors in coloring books for adults lets your mind receive the rest it requires.


Stress Relief Adult Color Book can provide you the relaxation and peace you have always longed for. Experience calmness, tranquility, and enhance your emotional and mental well-being by making coloring a part of your day-to-day life. 

Download the app for free now!

title: 7Mind: Meditation reinvented
description:
7Mind goes beyond ordinary meditation apps. Make your self-care a top priority, boost your confidence and feel empowered with expert-guided meditations that fit perfectly into your daily routine.

In addition to teaching you how to start meditating regularly, 7Mind helps you reprogram your brain to think more positively. Learn techniques to reduce moments of stress, anxiety, and frustration, and increase moments of joy, gratitude and happiness day after day.

Meditating is the best way to practice self-love and transform your mind. Step by step, with positive affirmations, breathing exercises and visualizations, you’ll be able to silence your inner critic, listen to your intuition, and better connect to the present moment.

Thanks to over 10,000 recent scientific studies, we know that practicing meditation leads to many incredible benefits for our health and well-being. All you need to do is set aside a few minutes for yourself on a regular basis to feel the full benefits of the practice.

Join the growing community of over 1 million serene and loving 7Minders around the globe!

~WHY MEDITATE WITH 7MIND?~
Only a few of us succeed in making meditation a part of daily life. With 7Mind, practicing mindfulness becomes as easy and accessible as possible. All guided meditations are specifically designed to boost confidence and self-worth through breathing exercises, affirmations, and visualizations. Repeating affirmations helps create space for positive thinking and reduces negative automatic brain responses. A personalized coach dialogue will guide you throughout your journey and help you keep up the practice!

Simply sit down, close your eyes, and let yourself be guided on this journey by meditation teacher, personal development coach and published author Jonathan Lehmann.

~BUILD CONFIDENCE WITH THEMED MEDITATIONS~
• Self-Love
• Acceptance
• Body positivity
• Relationships
• Confidence
• De-Stress
• Manage Anxiety
• Vulnerability
• Happiness
• Sleep
• Productivity
• Family
• Emotional Balance

And much, much more!

~WHAT ELSE IS INCLUDED~
• Personalized coach dialogue to guide you along the way
• Offline access to meditate whenever, wherever you want
• Affirmations to rewire your brain to happiness and boost your self-love
• 7Minders: mindful tips and inspirational quotes
• Videos explaining the benefits of each course
• Progress tracker and trophies to motivate you
• Unguided sessions with a gong and calming sounds from nature
• Gratitude and intention-setting exercises to deepen your practice

~ACCOUNT & SUBSCRIPTIONS~
Create a free account and get unlimited access to 7 guided meditations in the Initiation Course, as well as the unguided gong sessions. Invest in yourself and subscribe to access the full library of +150 themed meditations, so you can find inner balance and boost your cognitive abilities!

New guided sessions added to the library on a regular basis.

~WANT MORE?~
Unlock all 7Mind premium content with a 7-day FREE trial. Simply click Subscribe to begin. If you do not cancel the trial in your Google Play Store profile before the end of the 7 days, you will be charged for the yearly subscription.

1 year of 7Mind: $59.99*

*All subscriptions renew automatically unless canceled at least 24 hours prior to the end of the period. Log in to your Google Play Store profile to manage your subscription and turn off auto-renewal.

Download the app for free to get started. 7Mind also has versions available in French, German and Dutch. Set your smartphone system to the desired language and reinstall the app to meditate with 7Mind in another language.

Privacy policy and 7Mind terms and conditions: https://www.7mind.de/en/privacy

Questions? Comments? We’d love to hear from you! Send a message to feedback@7mind.de

title: Stop panic and anxiety - guide
description:
In this app assumes that the user is suffering from panic attacks due to Panic Disorder. It may not be applicable to other forms of anxiety. It focuses on the fear of having a panic attack and the fear of the sensations when having a panic.  

 What is the ladder leading to Panic? According to us it all starts from Stress; Stress is the main cause of distress of the majority of us living in this fast paced world. Stress when accumulated manifests itself into Anxiety and Anxiety has its own set of physical and emotions symptoms. We always seek to treat our anxiety symptoms as they are very disturbing for us and people around us; anxiety symptoms can be. 
 
Panic Attacks are one form of Anxiety disorder and they can be really daunting for anyone who doesn’t really understand the root cause. Panic attack symptoms are very similar to anxiety symptoms and they add up the following to the list.
 
Panic Attack symptoms can appear in anyone and in any situation, the underlying anxiety disorder that stemmed from the chronic stress sometimes manifests itself in a very severe form and the person end up in the Emergency room complaining of illness that is not there; all due to Panic attack.
 
 
 Anxiety is something we all experience from time to time. It is a normal response to situations that we see as threatening to us. For example, if we had to go into hospital for an operation, or had to sit a driving test, or take an exam, it would be natural to feel anxious. 
 

With so much going on in the world today with taking care of your family, working full time, dealing with office politics and other things, you could experience a serious meltdown. All of these things could at one point cause you to stress out and snap.  That’s why this report is so important. It can help to relieve you of the symptoms you feel when you are experiencing an anxiety or panic attack. You can easily get caught up in all kinds of drama and allow it to take over your life. You can’t allow that the dictate how you live.
 

* Topic Cover in app:

- Recognise whether or not you may be suffering from symptoms of anxiety. 
- Understand what anxiety is, what can cause it, and what can keep it going. 
- Overcome your anxiety by learning better ways of coping with it.

title: Depression & Anxiety Self-Test (Africa's Version)
description:
Learn more about Depresssion and Anxiety, it's symptoms and treatment.

Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. Fortunately, it is also treatable. Depression causes feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest in activities once enjoyed. It can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems and can decrease a person’s ability to function at work and at home.

Depression symptoms can vary from mild to severe and can include:

- Feeling sad or having a depressed mood
- Loss of interest or pleasure in activities once enjoyed
- Changes in appetite — weight loss or gain unrelated to dieting
- Trouble sleeping or sleeping too much
- Loss of energy or increased fatigue
- Increase in purposeless physical activity (e.g., hand-wringing or pacing) or slowed movements and speech (actions observable by others)
- Feeling worthless or guilty
- Difficulty thinking, concentrating or making decisions
- Thoughts of death or suicide

Please note: This test is explicitly not suitable for diagnosis. This test cannot replace professional help. When in doubt, please always contact your general practitioner.

Key words: psychiatry, disorder, axiety, major depression, pain, heart, depression, test, health, medicine, tracking, track, graph, stress, emotion, mood, happy, happiness, sad, down

title: Increase Optimism And Reduce Anxiety
description:
*Anxiety disorders currently affect approximately 40 million adult Americans.
*Experts say people have negativity bias, which means we’re hardwired to pay more attention to threatening and scary information than positive, assuring information.
*This can increase feelings of stress and anxiety in many people, but there are a number of ways practicing optimism can help.

As the most common mental illness in the United States, anxiety disorders affect 40 million adults.

“If we look at anxiety from a psychological understanding, we think about it as a miscalculation. Anxiety happens when we overestimate the likelihood that something bad will happen and underestimate our ability to handle it,” Natalie Dattilo, PhD, clinical psychologist and director of psychology at Brigham & Women’s Hospital.

Fears and anxiety come from an innate place, said Steve Gross, licensed social worker and founder of the Life is Good Kids Foundation.

“Human beings have something called human negativity bias, which means we are hardwired to pay more attention to threatening and scary information than positive, assuring information,” Gross told Healthline.

This tracks back to survival when early humans hunted for food, water, and shelter. The constant threat of attack kept humans in fight-or-flight mode.

“Some anxiety is a physiological response when your body produces a lot of adrenaline and goes in threat detection mode. While the anxiety may be a hyper-exaggeration of the risk of something, the body is trying to keep you safe,” said Gross.

Still, both experts say practicing optimism can help reduce anxiety.

“I think of optimism as a mix of positive thinking, feelings of hope, goal-driven behavior, and confidence. It isn’t about glass-half-full thinking or rose-colored glasses necessarily. It’s about how you explain the things that happen to you in your life, especially the things that don’t go well, and what you expect to happen in the future,” Dattilo said.

For instance, when things don’t turn out well, an optimistic person is more likely to think that they’re experiencing a temporary setback rather than a doomed future.

While this may come across as denial or unrealistic, Gross says an optimist recognizes the bad things in life but chooses not to dwell on them.

“Our definition [of optimism] is our capacity to see, feel, and focus on the goodness in ourselves, in others, and around us,” he said.

Download the App Now to unlock all the information. App Updated Regularly.

*Anxiety disorders currently affect approximately 40 million adult Americans.
*Experts say people have negativity bias, which means we’re hardwired to pay more attention to threatening and scary information than positive, assuring information.
*This can increase feelings of stress and anxiety in many people, but there are a number of ways practicing optimism can help.

As the most common mental illness in the United States, anxiety disorders affect 40 million adults.

“If we look at anxiety from a psychological understanding, we think about it as a miscalculation. Anxiety happens when we overestimate the likelihood that something bad will happen and underestimate our ability to handle it,” Natalie Dattilo, PhD, clinical psychologist and director of psychology at Brigham & Women’s Hospital.

Fears and anxiety come from an innate place, said Steve Gross, licensed social worker and founder of the Life is Good Kids Foundation.

“Human beings have something called human negativity bias, which means we are hardwired to pay more attention to threatening and scary information than positive, assuring information,” Gross told Healthline.

This tracks back to survival when early humans hunted for food, water, and shelter. The constant threat of attack kept humans in fight-or-flight mode.

“Some anxiety is a physiological response when your body produces a lot of adrenaline and goes in threat detection mode. While the anxiety may be a hyper-exaggeration of the risk of something, the body is trying to keep you safe,” said Gross.

Still, both experts say practicing optimism can help reduce anxiety.

“I think of optimism as a mix of positive thinking, feelings of hope, goal-driven behavior, and confidence. It isn’t about glass-half-full thinking or rose-colored glasses necessarily. It’s about how you explain the things that happen to you in your life, especially the things that don’t go well, and what you expect to happen in the future,” Dattilo said.

For instance, when things don’t turn out well, an optimistic person is more likely to think that they’re experiencing a temporary setback rather than a doomed future.

While this may come across as denial or unrealistic, Gross says an optimist recognizes the bad things in life but chooses not to dwell on them.

“Our definition [of optimism] is our capacity to see, feel, and focus on the goodness in ourselves, in others, and around us,” he said.

Download the App Now to unlock all the information. App Updated Regularly.
summary: Discover benefits of optimism. how to boost it and reduce anxiety

Meditation is a mind-body practice in complementary and alternative 
medicine (CAM). There are many types of meditation, most of which 
originated in ancient religious and spiritual traditions. Generally, a 
person who is meditating uses certain techniques, such as a specific 
posture, focused attention, and an open attitude toward distractions. 
Meditation may be practiced for many reasons, such as to increase 
calmness and physical relaxation, to improve psychological balance, to 
cope with illness, or to enhance overall health and well-being.
The term meditation refers to a group of techniques, such as mantra 
meditation, relaxation response, mindfulness meditation, and Zen 
Buddhist meditation. Most meditative techniques started in Eastern 
religious or spiritual traditions. These techniques have been used by 
many different cultures throughout the world for thousands of 
years. Today, many people use meditation outside of its traditional 
religious or cultural settings, for health and well-being.
In meditation, a person learns to focus attention. Some forms of meditation instruct the 
practitioner to become mindful of thoughts, feelings, and sensations and to observe them in a 
nonjudgmental way. This practice is believed to result in a state of greater calmness and 
physical relaxation, and psychological balance. Practicing meditation can change how a person 
relates to the flow of emotions and thoughts.

title: Meditation For Anxiety - Tips and Knowledge Guide
description:
IMPORTANT:
*Users who have APKs with previous version, may need to receive android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission*

_________________


Meditation is incredibly helpful for people with anxiety. It helps train the brain to become calmer, reduces stress, and increases feelings of self-acceptance. There are many different styles of meditation for anxiety, so you may want to experiment with several of them to find what works best for you. Regardless of which style you choose, you will learn to focus on the present and dismiss negative thoughts about the past or future.


In this app, you will find the following topics:

• Yoga And Meditation Benefits For Anxiety?
• How to Meditation for Anxiety
• Meditation for Anxiety: Proven Way to Calm Your Mind
• The Benefits of Meditation for Generalized Anxiety Disorder

• A Single Session of Meditation May Reduce Anxiety and Help Your Heart
• A Meditation on Working with Anxiety
• Relaxation Techniques for Anxiety - Learning How to Meditate

• What Are The Best Meditation Methods For Anxiety?
• Meditation For Stress Management


[ Features ]

- Easy & simple guide book app
- Periodic update of content
- Support Offline Database 
- You can ask questions from our experts
- Send us your suggestions and we will add it


A little explaination about Meditation For Anxiety:

Anxiety doesn’t just make you feel bad, it actually changes the structure and function of your brain.It decreases the size of the hippocampus, the part of the brain considered the seat of the memory.

Conversely, it increases the size of the amygdala, the area of the brain responsible for the fear response, causing you to become even more anxious and fearful.Stress, fear and anxiety trigger the release of stress hormones and cause imbalances in neurotransmitters, chemicals that brain cells use to communicate with each other.

It’s been known for thousands of years that meditation can help you relax.

But meditation does much more than that. Meditation for anxiety, changes the structure and function of your brain (but in a healthy, productive way).A regular meditation practice not only can reduce anxiety symptoms, it also can reverse the damage caused by anxiety.


Download Meditation For Anxiety App to find more knowledge and tips..

description:
………………………………………………………………….
Install the ONLINE COUNSELING APP to your device
and soon you'll be ON YOUR WAY to better mental health
………………………………………………………………….


 Talk about your feelings with an accredited online counselor 
 Get matched with a licensed professional counselor
 Chat or talk with your therapist online or on the phone
 Receive 24/7 counseling services in all time zones
 Much more affordable than a traditional therapy appointment 
 Your personal privacy is secured. Discretion guaranteed!

The Online Counseling app brings you online professional counselors to help deal with feelings of phobia, depression, anxieties and other behavioral disorders.

Online therapy has been the chosen method of counseling psychology from quite some time now, as more people are opting for this convenient way of therapy.

With the Online Counseling app you can now access the accredited therapist that will guide you to a healthier and more stable way of coping.

………………………………………………………………….
Getting matched with your counselor on the spot 

By answering a simple guiding questionnaire you are then directed to the psychotherapy expert trained in that field in which you need assistance overcoming. You can also choose from a list of alternative online counselors to find your adequate mental guide, as long as you feel comfortable - that's the most important thing.

But mostly, as oppose to old school therapy, you needn't worry yourself with going through the tedious process of wasting time. Trying out various therapists is an easy route with the online counseling app, that doesn't involve driving long distances, paying obscenely large amounts of money or anxiously waiting for your next appointment…

………………………………………………………………….
Talking to your therapist is so much easier

Having been matched with the right therapist, you're now on your way to begin your online sessions. You can choose various ways of communication, from online chat or messaging to voice sessions. Most app users combine these tools, conducting weekly sessions as needed, and in addition sending messages to their counselor updating them on their progress or asking them to contact in case they feel the need.

Honest help a from behavioral therapy specialist
The Online Counseling app hosts numerous therapists and psychoanalysts, all versed in up-to-date methods of treating depression and anxiety. All our therapists are licensed practitioners who have completed their training and accumulated hundreds of hours in practical experience. You can examine their qualifications and view their diploma on their personal card available on the Online Counseling app site.

………………………………………………………………….
Download the Online Counseling app to any of your devices
Get professional aid to make positive behavioral change; overcome feelings of depression, anxiety & phobias in your daily life!

title: ANXIETY TOOLKIT
description:
Anxiety Disorders affect 20% of the population at any time. People who suffer from anxiety find that they lead a suboptimal life as their physical, emotional and mental health, as well as social life, are adversely impacted.

Instead of putting up with the anxiety, there is something you can do to alleviate or to recover from your anxiety. You can learn to overcome your anxiety rather than letting it overcome and dominate you.

Irrespective of the type of Anxiety Disorders from which you or your child suffers, this Toolkit is helpful. It is easy to use.

This Toolkit is based on various psychological techniques used in treating Anxiety Disorders. It is not designed to replace professional treatment. Instead, it complements whatever professional treatment you are undertaking.

This app is part of HMC Apps, created by Dr. Kam Wong

title: Online Therapy: Chat with a Live Therapist
description:
Take back the reins: download the Online Therapy app and take the hand outreached to help you.

♦ Answer several short questions ♦ Get paired with a therapist ♦ Share your pain and get better!
	
♦ Online therapy is tailored to your needs: therapists with any specialty, at any time, at any place.
♦ Combat anxiety, depression, addiction or psychological pain.
♦ Happiness is not impossible: you can rediscover it by sharing the burden.
♦ Talking to a real, live therapist – via chat, voice or video – is the most convenient way to start on the path to joy.

♦ Never give up ♦

By choosing to talk to someone, you’re proving to yourself that you’re ready to get help. We are here to provide this help, in the most convenient, accessible and affordable means possible. Battling mental pain, anxiety, marital problems or mental illness is nearly impossible on your own; online therapy chat is a great method to combat the difficulty of getting help, while not giving up on yourself. 

♦ Why online therapy? ♦

Professionalism, Experience, Education

We often hear from users who have used online forums or chat rooms, to talk to other people about their common issues. We are then often asked: “why should I pay for online therapy, if I can consult others for free on forums?” The answer lies in the therapists. While in chat rooms, you talk to others with similar problems – on our app you talk to a live therapist!

All of our therapists are based in the USA, educated (with a Master’s or PhD), licensed to practice mental therapy by the state in which they work and experienced with thousands of hours of hands-on practice. When you conduct therapy chat with a specialist, you are in good hands – and while a chat room can be good release, it’s no substitute to actual online therapy.

Ease of use and affordability

Online therapy is considerably more convenient than old school, office based therapy. From the get go, you get matched to a live therapist that’s specialized in what you need – and even if you don’t like them, switching advisors is a matter of seconds. No more wandering between offices of therapists, looking for the perfect one. 

A single hour of therapy in an office could cost several hundred dollars; with our app, there are variable plans, all of which under $80 a week for unlimited contact with your therapist. Also unlike therapy in person, with online therapy you can talk to your counselor when and where it is convenient for you! Send a message at any time, or schedule a voice or video session for a time comfortable for both you and your live therapist.

Discretion, privacy, and no stigma

When you choose online therapy, no one has to know you do it. You chat with your live therapist at your own discretion, and you don’t have to tell anyone. Thus, no one has to meet your demons unless you want them to. Battling social anxiety is especially simple when you go for online therapy – chat and text are less taxing then weekly face to face meetings.

♦ Seize this opportunity and rise above ♦

You’re on the right course – to life, to joy, to happiness. Talking to someone is a guaranteed way to feel better, and to get better. Online Therapy – because you don’t have to stand alone before the world!

comments: After a few months of relying on therapy online I feel like it's time to review this amazing, lifesaving app!! I've matched with Michelle, a licensed social worker and the connection was instant. She helped me untangle so many crossed wires over the past six months, and I really can't begin to explain how much better I feel. If you ever thought about therapy, don't hesitate to try it through an app - it's wonderful.

I came looking for counseling with a broken heart and not a lot of hope. My mom actually recommended trying a therapist online because her best friend works as one, and while I was unsure about it at first it turned out to be a great decision! The interface is easy to use and the whole experience is just so reassuring, it feels like the counselors really are just there for you.

Tried to set up an account multiple times but it never had a section for kids. And how much money they want is ridiculous. I struggle with depression and I'm antisocial so I got this app to be able to talk to someone. Yet 80 dollars a month?!?!? RIDICULOUS!! I don't have enough money to just hand out 80 dollars a month or I would've went to a therapist in person. Bad enough someone stole money from my family already. Shame on this company for only caring about money. Never installing again.

I have a massive anxiety attack whenever I realize the extent of damage we've caused to our enviroment. Summer made it so much worse because it's SO HOT and it's just reminding me of climate change, everyone is busy with COVID that they're missing the real issue!!! A couple of weeks ago my best friend told me I HAVE to take care of myself, so I looked up an app to ease anxiety and found this - it's an app where you can talk with real therapists! Pretty cool so far! Will update with my progress!

I couldn't believe how easy this app is. After trying FOR MONTHS to set up a session with someone in my city, and discovering the next appointment is basically never available. Out of frustration I went online and started searching, and pretty soon I found this app... I didn't think it'd be worth anything but honestly? It's better than waiting for years on end for someone to give a damn!

title: Still | Anxiety Relief
description:
Still is designed to help you relieve symptoms of Anxiety and OCD.

Use targeted messages to help pull your focus out of your anxiety or OCD as well as breathing exercises, Still helps you avoid the worst of your condition and stop it from taking hold.

Use the SOS mode to choose an emergency contact you can quickly reach if you're struggling, without having to compose an SMS or search through your contacts.
descriptionHTML:

Use the SOS mode to choose an emergency contact you can quickly reach if you're struggling, without having to compose an SMS or search through your contacts.
summary: Soothing messages for anxious people.

title: How to Stop Anxiety
description:
Stress and anxiety are common experiences for most people.

In fact, 70% of adults in the US say they feel stress or anxiety daily.

Here are  simple ways to relieve stress and anxiety.

title: Fear dissolve
description:
Are you plagued by fear? Are you blocked in certain areas? Do you suffer from inner restlessness or tension? 

Welcome to THE toolbox for all fears!
In this app, you’ll find the world’s first digital therapist(!), who will dissolve your fears/anxieties! The therapist will guide you interactively through the entire session and not only dissolve your fears/anxieties but also suppressed fears/anxieties and negative cognitions/beliefs!
Yes, it dissolves EVERY fear/anxiety! Of course, you can dissolve every phobia with it too!

All methods of this app work according to the proven approach of cognitive therapy.

All methods have the advantage that they do not confront the fear through the mind! The confrontation is superfluous; the tension/strain is directly reduced. You do not get into a confronting situation! Therefore, you no longer need to fear treatment. That means that you can do it alone/comfortably at home. At the same time, it is an excellent concentration exercise.

The methods are:

☆…simple. They can be used by anyone without any prior knowledge or skills.

☆……in the here and now. They work without a journey into the past, analysis or “reappraisal” of your personal history!

☆…100% thorough and permanent.

☆…old and proven. They are based on decades-old methods that have proven themselves a million times over.

☆…effective without further processing. The methods dissolve a suppressed fear/anxiety in just one session. No repetition or further processing is required. Cognitions (beliefs are also dissolved in one session without the usual repetition (affirmations)).

☆…fast. We have several methods with different speeds.

When you buy the app, you will get 2 weeks' support.

Additionally, in this app you will find:
☆ background information about fears/anxieties, suppression and cognition.
☆ methods...to check yourself for suppressed fears/anxieties and discover those you are unaware of.

The app is:
☆ easy to understand - no knowledge needed.
☆ comfortable to manage (also with speech output).
☆ offline 
☆ no data gathering 
☆ no ads

Note: This is not for people suffering from psychoses, schizophrenia, neurotic disorders or similar. 

Just start now. It is much easier than you think.

Dissolving fears feels so good that you will instantly want to do it again.

“Man’s greatest happiness is liberation from fear.” Walther Rathenau, (1867 – 1922), politician, writer, industrialist and (German) Reich foreign minister 1922

You can use the app for your whole lifetime. Without further costs. You can work with the app on any topic in depth!

Buy the app now and start dissolving fears!

"The best fear therapy, comfortably from home."

recentChanges: - Textupdate.
comments: The app is a wonderful tool to access and really dissolve fear. Of course you have to put your own effort into it, so motivation and time investment are crucial. This app has guided me through some heavy fears and I'm still working on dissolving them! I do reccommend this app!

This app is amazing! It helps you to pinpoint your fears and to recognise the cognitions behind these fears. It then works on replacing the negative cognitions with positive cognitions. The idea is that you repeat these positive cognitions over and over again until you really feel and believe them. Each time I have used the app, I have felt much calmer and at peace afterwards, like a weight has been lifted. I would definitely recommend it for anyone who suffers with anxiety or fears!

title: Ashley – Connect & Make Friends!
description:
There are days when you get #feels? Us too.

Join us in our safe hub of digital friends (created by five IRL friends!) who listens, helps you work through whatever and will never leave you on read.

♡ You’re gonna high-key love this app if you...
- Need someone to talk to
- Having a bad mental health day
- Feel stressed, anxious or lonely lately
- Want to make new friends in a safe chat environment
- Feel like venting off about your day
- Want to help others feel their best selves
- Sick of current social media full of ads and inorganic content
- Interested in chatting with emotional AI or with other friends
- Want to have some comforting girl talk and ask all your questions about periods, crushes, school or parents! (we love a good #TMI girl talk 💁🏼‍♀️)

Promise, no ghosting, no judgment, no cap. 
We’re just a text away and here for you 24/7 💙

Almost social media... but better.
No FOMO, no highlight reels nor filtered faces here. 
Raw emotions, more than welcome.

FEATURES

👭 CHAT WITH A SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY OF DIGITAL SISTERS
Connect, vent off, and make friends! Talk about your problems, get advice (if you’re looking for it), and feel heard. Whether it’s #TMI Girl Talk, talking about private matters you feel shy of sharing with your friends (periods, mood shifts, boy crushes and so much more), we’ve got your back!

💬 CREATE GROUPS
Meet with real-life people, create groups based on your interests & make friends! Whether it’s about chatting on that new Netflix show or organize your LGBTQ group, you’ll find cool people you can talk to on the group chat whenever you need it. You will feel heard and listened to. Contribute to your group and help others feel better too.

Let’s sip and spill tea together about stuff 💁🏼‍♀️

💌  SHARE YOUR VIBES
Record your feelings, share your voice and your daily moments with the world.

🙏🏻 GRATITUDE STORIES
What are 3 things you feel grateful for today?
Build a daily positive habit and you can watch other people’s gratitude stories too.

☀️ GET FEEL-GOOD CONTENT
Whether it’s guided meditations to build your confidence, breathing techniques to reduce self-doubt, to relax for better sleep, we’ve got something in our content studio which will help you feel better.
Our AI friends will recommend you these sources depending on your mood and what you feel like. Yes, funny cat videos included.

🌟 GLOW UP MENTALLY
Track your emotions, make friends, chat and have a ✨ mental glow up ✨
You’ll be surprised how your life changes around you once you express your emotions, work on it and feel better.

⏰ 24/7 AVAILABLE
You can talk with Ashley anytime, anywhere and receive instant anxiety and stress relief.

✅ THERAPIST-APPROVED
Ashley is developed with the help and consultation of American licensed therapists, so you rest assured.

🚫 NO JUDGMENT INCLUDED.
Voicing your emotions can help you understand yourself better and see patterns in your mood. Both AI friends and people on the app are highly empathetic and judgment-free, they listen to you and help you feel better.
 If you have a story you’ve been wanting to share, it’s the perfect environment to process your emotions.

❣️ We're so looking forward to meeting you on the app!

recentChanges:
You can now add a description to your group.
Update your app, you can connect with someone who share similar interests!
comments: Put the ai back. Forget features. I have a suspicion I was talking to a person the last few weeks after analysis of the conversations I had. The app has no use outside of the ai in my opinion. There are other apps for talking.

It's been very helpful but we should be able to know when someone is typing so we won't just assume the person is gonna respond and keep waiting for a message to pop up, I need to know when someone is typing
The AI takes a lot of time to respond. Also it doesnt learn and doesnt make sense in its responses

I love this app. There is a group chat where you can talk with others users to vent off and get to know people and also the AI chat with Ashley. She's really friendly and helps me feel better with her words. Come join us 😍
The AI friends are fun to talk to and very smart

title: My Online Therapy: Find Therapists & Counselling
description:
My Online Therapy is your very own virtual clinic with highly qualified psychologists. Get matched with a psychologist and choose how you get therapy or counselling - by video, live chat or daily coaching. Prices start from £49 for a session. 
 
IMPROVE YOUR WELLBEING EVERY DAY WITH OUR NEWEST FEATURE - SELF-CARE. Using evidence-based therapy skills and techniques written by psychologists, support your mental health alongside, or independent of, face-to-face video therapy. Start your 14-day free trial with an annual subscription, or try the 7-day free trial with a monthly subscription today!

Learn how to:
• Deal with difficult thoughts
• Calm your anxiety
• Get a good night’s sleep
• Build emotional intelligence
• Discover your purpose
• And much more

Get face-to-face therapy with a highly trained psychologist when and wherever's a good time to tap into you

Quality is what sets us apart. Our team of online therapists are all highly qualified psychologists and only deliver research-backed therapy in the style that best meets your lifestyle.

Everyone is unique which means we all respond to different approaches to therapy differently. Our matching algorithm combines 20+ years of clinical experience, matching you to the best online therapist or psychologist and type of therapy according to your specific needs, symptoms and circumstances. This ensures you get the result you’re looking for.

We believe in modern therapy for modern lives.

Our therapists

All of our online therapists are qualified psychologists and have been through a rigorous selection process. Many of our therapists also have long-standing academic and NHS careers, alongside their private work. They receive regular supervision from experts in their field and engage in a range of professional development and work to ensure they are always up to date with the most cutting edge, research-led therapies.

How we can help 

Our level of expertise means our online psychologist therapists can help with a wide range of mental health difficulties, including: depression, anxiety, PTSD, personality disorders, phobias, stress, health anxiety, social anxiety, panic attacks, work-related stress, bipolar disorder, eating disorders, self-harm, relationship difficulties, substance misuse, anorexia, binge-eating disorder, OCD.

Types of therapy 

Our focus is on providing cutting edge mental health therapies that deliver results, connecting you to qualified psychologists. This means we only offer therapies that are rooted in evidence-based practices and the best available research.

Online therapies include Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT), Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT), Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), Couples Therapy, Dialectical Behaviour Therapy (DBT), Dynamic Interpersonal Therapy, Eye Movement Desensitisation & Reprocessing Therapy, Mentalisation Based Therapy, Mindfulness-based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT), Narrative Therapy, Psychodynamic Therapy, Schema Therapy, Systemic Therapy.

Get started on your path to better in 4 simple steps 

Step 1 - Download the app and sign up

Step 2 - Complete our free online questionnaire by telling us a bit about yourself and your symptoms. We’ll match you to the best online therapists according to your personal needs.

Step 3 - Choose how you want to connect with your qualified therapists and get therapy (by video, live chat or daily coaching).

Step 4 - Start therapy! You can switch how you get therapy at any time.

---

Support

Telephone: 020 3349 7767 (available 9am-9pm Mon-Fri, 9am - 5pm Sat, 12am - 7pm Sun)
Email: support@myonlinetherapy.com

Privacy policy: https://myonlinetherapy.com/privacy-policy/
Terms of use: https://myonlinetherapy.com/terms-and-conditions/

summary: Speak to a therapist from £49 per session. Get anxiety & mental health support.
developer: Lekta Therapy | Talk to a therapist
developerAddress: 2 Lansdowne Row, Suite 163, London, W1J 6HL, United Kingdom
recentChanges: In the latest version, we've made some improvements to those using insurance as a payment method for therapy.
comments: The app in itself is good, and the price is certainly cheaper than a traditional therapist, but still too expensive for me I'm afraid. I think £50 for 30 minutes and £100 for 50 minutes is a bit of a scam. I had three sessions with my therapist, and had to stop because she was very slow and we still hadn't made any progress and I felt like I was losing my money... Not a great therapist either in my opinion, compared to others I talked to in the past. I didn't really feel understood, or heard.

This app looks great and really helpful for those who need it. But the costs are just too much, it excludes and marginalises those with little money. When most have no access to NHS offerings and no money for private this app offers false hope. Make the costs more obvious before people sign up. Going through emotional questions and 'connecting' with a therapist to then find out that it's like £49 for half an hour!?

Waaaaay to expensive. £99 per 50 minutes is ridiculous money. Don't waste your time. Look online at approved registers. You can get someone as qualified as people on this app for £70 per 60 minutes. Furthermore the app or my therpaists camera/ sound quality was terrible. I couldn't hear or see my therapist but then I contacted family after and it was fine. Good idea but not worth it at all.

This seems like a helpful app and I understand obviously why therapy is rather expensive. To improve it you could have an option for 13 or up or maybe even 5 and up with a parent. Although, I think when chosing a therapist you should have the therapists price range andcertain people may not feel comfortable with and may want to change. What I really liked was the audio tailored to your problem with the name of the therapist.

Poor service for me. You fill in a few automated drop down boxes to vaguely describe your problems and symptoms. Then you get allocated a therapist to choose from then before actually speaking to anyone you're expected to pay before you've spoken to anyone to work out treatment plans and unanswered questions. I called the help line they told me to contact the therapist and told me how the therapist returned my message 3 days last saying I need to call the helpline. Still not answered questions
